_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Complete Welders Supply is a compressed gas distribution facility.  We deliver compressed gas in cylinders to manufacturing facilities that use these products in industry.  Complete Welders Supply does not use the product in any manufacturing process our primary roll and exposure to Sulfur Dioxide and Ammonia are in storage and handling.



The Complete Welders Supply facility in Napa, California has adopted this Program in order to implement Title 8 of the California Code of Regulations (CCR), Section 5189, the California OSHA standard regulating Process Safety Management (PSM) of Acutely Hazardous Materials for sulfur dioxide.



This program has also been developed to implement the prevention component of Title 19 CCR, Division 2, chapter 4.5, also known as the California Accidental Release Prevention (CaIARP) Program. The hazardous materials at this facility that meet the CalARP eligibility requirements are sulfur dioxide and ammonia. As per Section 2735.4 (Applicability) of the CalARP program, the Napa Hazardous Materials Certified Unified Program Agency (CUPA) and this facility have determined that these material processes meet the eligibility requirements of Program Level 3 and Level 2, respectively. As required by Article 5 for Program Level 2 and Article 6 for Level 3 of the CalARP Program, the applicable prevention components are

detailed in this single document.



This Program will help prevent the occurrence of, or minimize the consequences of, catastrophic releases by stating and implementing our policies and procedures for the management of process hazards in design, construction, start-up, operation, inspection, maintenance, and other matters addressed in the OSHA standard. This program has been developed to enable all those who may be affected to be able to identify and understand the hazards posed by the processes that involve the covered chemicals.



Our Program calls for maximum employee participation and includes all elements of the employee p

articipation provisions of the OSHA standard. We shall, as a minimum: (1) consult with employees and their representatives on the conduct and development of process hazard analyses, on the development of the OSHA standard's other elements of process safety management, and (2) provide to our employees and their representatives access to the process hazard analyses and all other information required to be developed under that standard.



This Process Safety Management Program will be regularly reviewed and updated as provided in Section 16.0 (Compliance Audits), and whenever necessary to reflect new or modified tasks and procedures. A copy of this Program, as well as the other documents and reports that are created pursuant to this Program, will be accessible to our employees. 



Complete Welders Supply has not had an accidental releases in the past 7 years.
